results.title: Bushfires: your safety and survival
results.brief_description: Made especially for television information purposes, this film is introduced by Sir Henry Bolte, (Premier of Victoria in 1969). It tells how to prevent, prepare against, and fight bush fires. It also explains how to defend your home, property and life when fire threatens.

results.title: Bushfire moon
results.brief_description: It’s the week before Christmas, 1891. The Australian bush is tinder dry as a fierce drought brings an infant nation to its knees. When eight year old Ned O’Day mistakes a roguish ex-miner for Father Christmas, Ned’s firm belief and sense of wonder bring about a startling turn of events. Stars John Waters and Dee Wallace.

results.title: Bushfire brigade
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Eric Thompson
results.brief_description: Illustrates the danger of bushfires and describes how bodies such as the Volunteer Bushfire Brigade and the Forestry Firefighting gangs are organised to prevent and fight bushfires.

results.title: Bushed
results.brief_description: An animated story concerning a displaced Aboriginal and and out-of-place kangaroo meet and decide to go ‘bush’, only to discover that they are intruders on their own land. A satire of life as an Aboringine during the resources boom of the 1970’s, bushed explorer problems faced by Aborigines seeking employment, the ethics of tourism, slaughtering of kangaroos for pet food, and european denial of prior ownership by Aborigines. This program carries a strong environmental message of the impact of colonisation on our native fauna.

results.title: Bushed
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Steve French
results.brief_description: An animated story about a displaced Aboriginal who meets a misplaced kangaroo. Together they “travel the bush of Australia like true-born native men”. But the bush has changed and they discover that “you can’t go home again”.

results.title: Bushcraft
results.brief_description: Before setting out on a camping trip, careful planning is necessary. The film demonstrates the choice of equipment, the proper food and clothing required and how a rucksack should be packed. For the trip itself, other hints include the various ways to cross a river, finding the route, marking the trail, building a fire and the correct handling of firearms.

results.title: Bush tucker man
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Defence and Vincent Donovan
results.brief_description: The Australian Army’s botanist, Major Les Hiddins is studying the natural survival resources of the vast wilderness of northern Australia. This study takes into account the native bush foods and medicines that have sustained Aboriginal people and is the first study of its kind since European settlement. It provides valuable information for Australian soldiers should they ever have to survive in such an inhospitable region. Some unique flora is also discovered. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Bush policemen
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Stanley Hawes and Lee Robinson
results.brief_description: The bush policeman’s beat, in the vast inland of Australia, takes him through strange and sometimes un-mapped places, to preserve law and order on the fringes of civilization. As the Mountie is to north-west Canada, so is the bush policeman to the wild, tropical north-west of Australia.

results.title: Bush pilot: reflections on a Canadian myth
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jerry Krepakevich, Michael Scott, Bob Lower and Norma Bailey
results.brief_description: For some bush pilots, flying is like playing solo violin at Carnegie Hall. For others, it’s like driving a taxi. This film shows how bush pilots are slowly being replaced. In northern towns built by bulldozers and jet aircraft, the emphasis is not on adapting to the north, but on remaking it in the image of the south. This is a thought provoking film about northern development.

results.title: Bush Mechanics animation (2015)
results.brief_description: In the central Australian desert, four Warlpiri men travel to visit a powerful elder at a remote outstation. On the road they must overcome mechanical mishaps and the trickery of a mischievous spirit. It will take all of their bush ingenuity to keep their car running and themselves alive.

constellations_other.name: Culture and identity on the Australian screen
constellations_other.description: Australian screen culture is distinctive, unexpected, playful and serious when it matters. Indigenous productions make a huge contribution to the unique identity of the Australian moving image.
